metadata.title: Lagrangian measurements in the Kamchatka Current and Oyashio

creators.name: Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)

metadata.description: From 1988 to 1993, 23 satellite-tracked drifting buoys entered the Kamchatka Current. The buoy trajectories showed a well-formed, high-speed current that originated near Shirshov Ridge, and flowed southward through Kamchatka Strait. During some years, the buoys turned eastward at ~50°N, while in other years they were transported as far south as Japan (40°N). Only one buoy entered the Sea of Okhotsk. Eddies were evident in many of the buoy trajectories. Greatest maximum daily velocities (> 100 cm s) were observed south of Kamchatka Strait, with 50-60 cm s being more common.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To form a Lagrangian profile of satellite-tracked drifting buoys entered the Kamchatka Current from 1998 to 1993.

Status: Complete
